result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher L. Strasser

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy
Case called at 9:13 a.m. 
Defendant appears in person.

Court questions defendant RE: Employment/Income. 

Court appoints Attorney Jay Kronenwetter @ $100/hr. not to exceed $1750.00  without further order of the Court. 

Adj:  9:14 a.m.
No violent contact with B.A.B. and no discussion of contents of case amongst each other. Third party child exchange through neutral third party.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:00 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

Date and time set for bond modification hearing; VRCW. 
COURT recites history of matter.  
ADA Zibolski makes statement.  

COURT makes findings and grants bond modification.  

COURT modifies conditions and removes no contact with B.A.B.
COURT amends bond conditions:  NO violent contact with B.A.B. and no discussion of contents of case amongst each other.  

COURT continues previously set court dates. 

Adj:  9:02 a.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Kristopher L. Strasser
Current: 108 1/2 North Thomas St., Merrill, WI 54452 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2022)
Prior: 237587 County Road W, Wausau, WI 54403
From defendant, request to waive no-contact order
Letter from B.S., requesting that 72-hour no contact be waived

Pre-trial conference on November 7, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Final pre-trial on December 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 7, 2023 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): B.A.B. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Third party child exchange through neutral third party.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:26 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Krista Cannon.   

COURT addresses a letter received by defendant questioning if they are related; Court reassures defendant they are not related whatsoever.  Defendant understands. 
Date and time set for initial appearance; VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
PLEA:  Not guilty.  

BOND:  $500.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): B.A.B. 
- 3rd party child exchange through neutral third party. 

PTC:  11/07/22 at 10:10 a.m. 
FPT/TP:  12/16/22 at 11:00 a.m. 
JT:  2/07/23 at 9:00 a.m. 

Adj:  2:30 p.m. 

Branch 4.
